body: You grew up in a region not typically associated with the lands that your people call home. Roll on the Unusual Homeland table to determine the homeland of your family. If the result is one that is typical for your race, this region is one where there are few other members of your race, outside of your family.
name: Unusual Homeland
url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Unusual Homeland

sections.body:
Unusual Homeland
d%Result
01—10Subterranean: You gain access to the Surface Stranger regional trait.
11—25Mountains: You gain access to the Highlander regional trait.
26—40Plains: You gain access to the Savanna Child regional trait.
41—50Town or Village: You gain access to the Militia Veteran regional trait.
51—60City or Metropolis: You gain access to the Civilized social trait and the Vagabond Child regional trait.
61—70Forest: You gain access to the Log Roller regional trait.
71—80River, Swamp, or Wetlands: You gain access to the River Rat regional trait.
81—85Desert: You gain access to the Desert Child regional trait.
86—90Sea: You gain access to the Sea-Souled regional trait.
91—95Tundra: You gain access to the Tundra Child regional trait.
96—100Another Plane: Your GM chooses the plane. You gain access to the Scholar of the Great Beyond faith trait.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Unusual Homeland/Unusual Homeland
sections.name: Unusual Homeland
